intro: Tylecarpus coriifolius, commonly known as the broadleaf tylecarpus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its large, leathery, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
